globus-job-run grid3.aset.psu.edu/jobmanager-pbs /bin/date Command is queued on the batch scheduler and will run when
globus-job-run grid3.aset.psu.edu/jobmanager-pbs /bin/date
Command is queued on the batch scheduler and will run when
the job reaches the front of the queue. The job may wait in the queue for minutes to hours depending on your priority and how busy the resource is.
the job reaches the front of the queue. The job may wait in the
queue for minutes to hours depending on your priority and
how busy the resource is.

page.title:
Running jobs on the Grid
Running jobs on the Grid
page.footer:
OSG Consortium Mtg March 2007 Quick Start Guide to the OSG
OSG Consortium Mtg March 2007
Quick Start Guide to the OSG
page.enlisting:
• Globus is built on a Resource Specification Language (RSL) which can control batch schedulers that manage clusters. • An RSL example: • &(executable=“/bin/ls”) (directory=“/tmp”) (arguments=“-l”) • Place the RSL string in a file: myjob.rsl • Try: globusrun -s -r osg-itb.ligo.caltech.edu -f myjob.rsl • Try globusrun –s –r osg-itb.ligo.caltech.edu/jobmanager- – But for more robust job management use Condor-G! • Globus is built on a Resource Specification Language
• Globus is built on a Resource Specification Language
(RSL) which can control batch schedulers that manage clusters. • An RSL example:
(RSL) which can control batch schedulers that
manage clusters.

page.footer:
OSG Consortium Mtg March 2007 Quick Start Guide to the OSG

Quick Start Guide to the OSG
page.enlisting:
• Globus virtualized the interface to high performance • However, run-time event management in distributed systems is needed: – Gatekeeper may be down. – GridFTP server may be down. – Operating system may become unresponsive. – Batch scheduler may become unresponsive. – Submit host may not be able to stage-out results of a • Condor-G/DAGman provides a means to monitor and manage end-to-end events during a Grid application execution. • Globus virtualized the interface to high performance
• Globus virtualized the interface to high performance
• However, run-time event management in distributed
• However, run-time event management in distributed
systems is needed: – Gatekeeper may be down. – GridFTP server may be down. – Operating system may become unresponsive. – Batch scheduler may become unresponsive. – Submit host may not be able to stage-out results of a
systems is needed:
– Gatekeeper may be down.
– GridFTP server may be down.
– Operating system may become unresponsive.
– Batch scheduler may become unresponsive.
– Submit host may not be able to stage-out results of a
• Condor-G/DAGman provides a means to monitor and manage end-to-end events during a Grid application execution.
• Condor-G/DAGman provides a means to monitor and
manage end-to-end events during a Grid application
execution.
computing resources and file transfers.
computing resources and file transfers.

page.enlisting:
• Condor folks created the globus universe. Condor scripts • Condor scripts are submitted by the user running a Condor client and having a local condor queue. So Grid job management is simplified for the user due to Condor toolset: – condor_submit: submit a condor script. – condor_q: check the status of a condor job. – condor_rm: remove a condor job from the queue. • Condor folks created the globus universe. Condor scripts
• Condor folks created the globus universe. Condor scripts
• Condor scripts are submitted by the user running a Condor
• Condor scripts are submitted by the user running a Condor
client and having a local condor queue. So Grid job management is simplified for the user due to Condor toolset: – condor_submit: submit a condor script. – condor_q: check the status of a condor job. – condor_rm: remove a condor job from the queue.
client and having a local condor queue. So Grid job
management is simplified for the user due to Condor
toolset:
– condor_submit: submit a condor script.
– condor_q: check the status of a condor job.
– condor_rm: remove a condor job from the queue.
submitted to the globus universe are submitted to a Globus gatekeeper or GridFTP server and use all of the resources of Globus jobs.
submitted to the globus universe are submitted to a Globus
gatekeeper or GridFTP server and use all of the resources
of Globus jobs.

page.title:
A simple Condor-G script
A simple Condor-G script
page.normal_text:
universe = globus executable = /bin/ls notification = NEVER globusrsl = (jobtype=single) globusscheduler = osg-itb.ligo.caltech.edu/jobmanager-condor copy_to_spool = false error = /home/dmeyers/osg-itb.err log = /home/dmeyers/osg-itb.log output = /home/dmeyers/osg-itb.out transfer_executable = false transfer_error = true transfer_output = true periodic_release = (NumSystemHolds <= 3) periodic_remove = (NumSystemHolds > 3) remote_initialdir = /home/dmeyers queue
universe = globus
executable = /bin/ls
notification = NEVER
globusrsl = (jobtype=single)
globusscheduler = osg-itb.ligo.caltech.edu/jobmanager-condor
copy_to_spool = false
error = /home/dmeyers/osg-itb.err
log = /home/dmeyers/osg-itb.log
output = /home/dmeyers/osg-itb.out
transfer_executable = false
transfer_error = true
transfer_output = true
periodic_release = (NumSystemHolds <= 3)
periodic_remove = (NumSystemHolds > 3)
remote_initialdir = /home/dmeyers
queue
page.footer:
OSG Consortium Mtg March 2007 Quick Start Guide to the OSG
OSG Consortium Mtg March 2007
Quick Start Guide to the OSG

page.title:
DAGman
DAGman
page.footer:
OSG Consortium Mtg March 2007 Quick Start Guide to the OSG
OSG Consortium Mtg March 2007
Quick Start Guide to the OSG
page.enlisting:
• DAG manager (DAGman) is an extension to the Condor system • Many scientific and engineering workflows can be modeled as a • Each DAG node is tracked and its status determined by the • DAG manager (DAGman) is an extension to the Condor system
• DAG manager (DAGman) is an extension to the Condor system
• Many scientific and engineering workflows can be modeled as a
• Many scientific and engineering workflows can be modeled as a
• Each DAG node is tracked and its status determined by the
• Each DAG node is tracked and its status determined by the
that adds a Directed Acyclic Graph(DAG) abstraction.
that adds a Directed Acyclic Graph(DAG) abstraction.
collection of DAG nodes.
collection of DAG nodes.
DAG manager. Errors are handled by auto-restarting a failed node to increase reliability. Condor has the notion of a rescue DAG which represents the place in the Graph where a workflow can be restarted from, to resume a workflow.
DAG manager. Errors are handled by auto-restarting a failed
node to increase reliability. Condor has the notion of a rescue
DAG which represents the place in the Graph where a workflow
can be restarted from, to resume a workflow.

page.title:
DAGman
DAGman
page.normal_text:
An example input file for DAGMan is # Filename: diamond.dag Job A A.condor Job B B.condor Job C C.condor Job D D.condor Script PRE A top_pre.csh Script PRE B mid_pre.perl $JOB Script POST B mid_post.perl $JOB $RETURN Script PRE C mid_pre.perl $JOB Script POST C mid_post.perl $JOB $RETURN Script PRE D bot_pre.csh PARENT A CHILD B C PARENT B C CHILD D Retry C 3
An example input file for DAGMan is
# Filename: diamond.dag
Job A A.condor
Job B B.condor
Job C C.condor
Job D D.condor
Script PRE A top_pre.csh
Script PRE B mid_pre.perl $JOB
Script POST B mid_post.perl $JOB $RETURN
Script PRE C mid_pre.perl $JOB
Script POST C mid_post.perl $JOB $RETURN
Script PRE D bot_pre.csh
PARENT A CHILD B C
PARENT B C CHILD D
Retry C 3
page.footer:
OSG Consortium Mtg March 2007 Quick Start Guide to the OSG
OSG Consortium Mtg March 2007
Quick Start Guide to the OSG

DAGMan

http://www.cs.wisc.edu/condor/manual/v6.4/2_11DAGMan_Applications.html#fig:dagman-diamond

Automatic Tools exist to convert DAGs into Condor-G submit scripts that can be run with the Condor command: condor- submit-dag.
Automatic Tools exist to convert DAGs into Condor-G submit
scripts that can be run with the Condor command: condor-
submit-dag.

at: http://pegasus.isi.edu/
at: http://pegasus.isi.edu/
